alert.note: Alert for Johnson (Iowa) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS QuadCities (Eastern Iowa and Northwestern Illinois - Quad Cities)
info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued May 13 at 12:57PM CDT until May 13 at 1:30PM CDT by NWS QuadCities
info.description: The National Weather Service in the Quad Cities has issued a * Severe Thunderstorm Warning for... Northeastern Johnson County in east central Iowa... * Until 130 PM CDT. * At 1257 PM CDT, a severe thunderstorm was located over Coralville, or near Iowa City, moving north at 15 mph. HAZARD...Quarter size hail. SOURCE...Trained weather spotters. IMPACT...Damage to vehicles is expected. * This severe thunderstorm will be near... Coralville Lake Dam Complex and West Overlook around 110 PM CDT. North Liberty, Sugar Bottom Camp Ground and Newport around 115 PM CDT. Other locations in the path of this severe thunderstorm include Morse. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.00 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...<50 MPH
info.instruction: A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 700 PM CDT for east central Iowa. For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a sturdy building. A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 700 PM CDT for east central Iowa.
